name: Marinated Peppers
ingredients: fresh ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Bake whole peppers in oven at 350° F to 375° F for 30 minutes or more until wilted - turn from time to time while baking.
Mix all other ingredients and let stand while peppers are baking.
Skin the peppers, core, remove seeds, and cut into small slices.
Pour marinade over peppers (add 2 tablespoons of capers, if desired) and let stand until cool, or overnight if time permits.

name: Frosted Pineapple Squares
ingredients: 1 egg yolk, slightly beaten (or egg substitute)
4 egg yolks at room temperature (or egg substitute)
instructions: Mix 1/2 cup of sugar, cornstarch and salt together in saucepan. Stir in slightly beaten egg yolk and undrained pineapple chunks. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil. Set aside to cool.

In a large bowl, thoroughly mix 1 & 1/3 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of sugar, and undissolved yeast. Combine milk, water, and margarine in a saucepan. Heat over low heat until liquids are warm. (Margarine does not need to melt). Gradually add to dry ingredients and beat for 2 minutes at medium speed of electric mixer, scraping bowl occasionally.

Add egg yolks and 1/2 cup of flour, or just enough flour to make a thick batter. Beat at high speed for 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Stir in enough additional flour to make a soft, moist dough.

Divide dough in half. Roll out 1/2 of the dough on floured board to fit the bottom of an ungreased 15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1 inch jelly roll pan. Spread with cooled pineapple filling. Roll remaining dough large enough to cover filling. Seal edges together. Snip surface of the dough with scissors to let steam escape.

Cover, let rise in warm place, free from draft, until doubled in bulk. This will take about 1 hour. Bake in moderate oven (375°F) about 35 to 40 minutes, or until done. Let cake cool in pan. Frost while warm with confectioners' sugar frosting. Cut into squares to serve.

name: Mushroom and Nut Pate
ingredients: dash of tabasco sauce, or to taste
instructions: Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and garlic. Saute until the liquid has evaporated. Set aside.
Coarsely chop almonds in food processor or blender. Remove and set aside two tablespoons of the almonds; continue chopping remaining almonds while slowly adding oil until mixture is well blended.
Add mushrooms and seasonings. Blend thoroughly. Stir in reserved almonds. Place pate in a crock or small bowl. Sprinkle with chopped parsley or sesame seeds. Chill for two hours before serving.
Yield: 1 cup. 55 calories per tablespoon

name: Roasted Nuts
instructions: Roast for 30 to 40 minutes at 250° F - check every ten minutes.

name: Basic Sweet Dough
ingredients: 4 & 1/2 to 5 cups sifted all purpose flour

name: Turkey Sausage
source: Wilfred F. and Alma Finken Carle
ingredients: 4 large cloves of well mashed garlic
instructions: Blend wheat germ with vegetable oil and let stand over night. Then add to ground turkey breast and mix well.
Add other ingredients. Items may be added or omitted and quantities increased or decreased to suit taste.
Mix well, if too dry, add a little water.

name: Pizza (Carle Version)
ingredients: 1 package (6.5 oz.) Gold Medal Pizza Crust mix
1 can (4 oz) mushrooms, drained (stems and pieces)
ham or turkey ham, small strips
Ragu Pizza natural sauce (comes in 14 oz. jar)
instructions: Prepare crust according to package instructions.
Spray pizza pan with a nonstick vegetable cooking spray and then sprinkle pan with a thin layer of cornmeal.
Place dough in center of pan and dampen finger tips with water or oil. Then spread dough by pressing it out, well to the edge of the pan.
Bake at 450° F for 10 to 15 minutes, until light brown.
Remove from oven and put pizza sauce on crust. Use whatever quantity you prefer and spread it with a spoon.
Add cut up toppings in quantities desired.
Put back in oven and bake another 15 minutes. Remove and cover with grated or sliced Mozzarella cheese.
Bake another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

name: Fettuccine Primavera
ingredients: 1 cup of fully cooked, smoked breast of turkey, cubed
1 cup each of broccoli flowerlets and carrot slices
1 package (8 oz.) light neufchatel cheese, cubed
instructions: Cook pasta as directed on package, adding broccoli and carrots during last 5 minutes of cooking.
Stir together milk, neufchatel cheese, onions and seasoning in medium saucepan over low heat until smooth.
Stir in turkey and Parmesan cheese.
Toss pasta and vegetables with sauce. Serve immediately. Makes six servings. Preparation time is 25 minutes.

name: Jumbo Shells No. 1 - Spinach-Ricotta Filling
instructions: In a large saucepan combine the fresh spinach with a small amount of water. Simmer, covered for 3 to 5 minutes. Drain well. Squeeze the spinach to remove excess moisture. Chop spinach.
In a skillet cook onion in margarine till tender but not brown. Add spinach; heat through.
Combine egg, ricotta, Parmesan, nutmeg and spinach mixture. Pour half of the sauce in a baking dish.
Stuff (20) shells with filling, arrange in dish and top with remaining sauce. Bake in 350° oven 30 minutes.
FOR TOMATO SAUCE SEE RECIPE THIS SECTION AND/OR ON BACK OF THIS RECIPE.

name: Tomato Sauce
instructions: Saute onion and garlic in oil. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Pour half the sauce in a baking dish. Stuff shells (cooked as per instructions on box), arrange in dish and top with remaining sauce.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 minutes.

name: Jumbo Shells No. 2 - Meat Filling
ingredients: 1 lb. of ground beef or chicken
instructions: Saute chopped meat in olive oil until brown. Mix with egg, or egg substitute, cheese, bread crumbs, parsley, salt and pepper.
Pour half of the sauce in a baking dish. Stuff (20) shells with filling, arrange in dish and top with remaining sauce.
Bake in 350° oven 30 minutes.
FOR TOMATO SAUCE SEE RECIPE THIS SECTION AND/OR ON BACK OF THIS RECIPE.

name: Pizza Dough (Crusty)
ingredients: 2 & 1/2 to 3 & 1/2 cups of all purpose flour
instructions: Sprinkle yeast over warm water in warmed bowl; let stand five minutes.
Add salt, olive oil and 2 & 1/2 cups of flour. Attach bowl and bowl hook.
Turn to speed 2 and mix for two minutes. Add remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until dough clings to hook and cleans sides of bowl.
Knead on speed 2 for 5 minutes.

Place in bowl that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray. Spray the top of the dough with a coating of the vegetable spray. Cover; let rise in warm place, free from draft, until doubled in bulk (takes about one hour). Punch dough down.

Coat a 14" diameter pizza pan with nonstick vegetable spray; sprinkle with cornmeal. Press dough across bottom of pan, forming a collar around edge to hold filling. Top with desired fillings. Bake at 450° F for 15 to 20 minutes. Makes one 14" pizza.
Variation: To make a pizza bread, just cover the crust with olive oil and powdered garlic. Sprinkle with rosemary and Parmesan cheese (all to taste). Bake as above-serve hot.

name: Spaghetti Portofino (Serves One)
ingredients: 2 Tablespoons minced fresh garlic in oil
small handful of red snapper or halibut filets cut in small strips
1/2 cup mussels (must be fresh, if not available, add same quantity to fish filets)
instructions: Combine ingredients in order listed, prepared at the table:
Warm garlic in oil and margarine in skillet over medium flame (sterna). Add fish and saute about one minute. Add brandy and ignite. When flame goes out add mussels and rest of the ingredients.
Add spaghetti, simmer one to two minutes. Serve with salad and French bread.

name: Spaghetti Portofino (Serves Six)
source: Revised from original recipe by Kenneth Carle
ingredients: 8 large cloves of fresh garlic (minced) in oil
3 tablespoons of olive oil and 2 tablespoons of melted margarine
1 & 1/2 pounds of red snapper or halibut cut in small strips
1/2 cup brandy (such as Napoleon French brandy)
instructions: Combine ingredients in order listed. Warm garlic in olive oil and margarine in wok (medium heat).
Add fish and saute about three minutes. Add brandy and rest of ingredients. Add spaghetti and bring to a simmer.
Serve with salad and French bread

name: Meringue
ingredients: cream of tartar (1/4 tsp for 9-inch, 1/4 tsp for 8-inch, 1/8 tsp for 6-inch)
sugar (6 tbsp for 9-inch, 4 tbsp for 8-inch, 2 tbsp for 6-inch)
instructions: Beat egg whites until frothy, add cream of tartar, and continue beating until stiff enough to hold a point.
Gradually beat in sugar...continuing beating until mixture is stiff and glossy.
Slow and complete blending of sugar prevents beads of sugar in meringue.
Pile meringue lightly on cooled pie filling...seal it onto edge of crust to prevent shrinking.
Swirl or pull up points to make it look decorative.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes (until a delicate brown) in a slow oven (300°) to set and bake the meringue so it will hold up.
Let cool at room temperature away from drafts, as cold air makes it fall and condenses moisture on top of filling.

name: Vanilla Cream Pie
ingredients: sugar (2/3 cup for 9-inch, 1/2 cup for 8-inch, 1/3 cup for 6-inch)
salt (2/3 tsp for 9-inch, 1/2 tsp for 8-inch, 1/3 tsp for 6-inch)
cornstarch (2 2/3 tbsp for 9-inch, 2 tbsp for 8-inch, 1 1/3 tbsp for 6-inch)
flour (1 1/3 tbsp for 9-inch, 1 tbsp for 8-inch, 1/2 tbsp for 6-inch)
milk (2 2/3 cups for 9-inch, 2 cups for 8-inch, 1 1/3 cups for 6-inch)
egg substitute (3/4 cup for 9-inch, 1/2 cup for 8-inch, 1/4 cup for 6-inch)
vanilla (1 1/3 tsp for 9-inch, 1 tsp for 8-inch, 1/2 tsp for 6-inch)
margarine (2/3 tbsp for 9-inch, 1/2 tbsp for 8-inch, 1/3 tbsp for 6-inch)
instructions: Mix sugar, salt, cornstarch and flour in top of double boiler. Stir in milk. Bring to boil over low heat, and boil 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.

Stir a little of the hot mixture into the egg substitute...then blend into hot mixture. Place over boiling water, and cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Blend in margarine. Cool thoroughly. Blend in vanilla.
Pour into cooled baked pie shell. Finish with meringue (see recipe, this section).

name: Apple Pie
ingredients: 4 or 5 cooking apples, depending on size
3/4 to 1 cup of sugar (quantity depends on tartness of the apples)
2 unbaked pie crusts (see pie crust recipe, this section)
instructions: Peel, core and dice enough Granny Smith or any other cooking apples to fill crust to "rounding". The apples will cook down when the pie is baked.
Put these cut up apples in a large bowl and mix well with the other ingredients. Place this mixture in the "bottom" crust and spread out evenly. Margarine can be poured over the mixture, if desired.
Put a crust that has been pierced with air holes on top of the pie. Secure it to the "bottom" crust by using fork prongs or your fingers.
Bake pie at 400° for 15 minutes; reduce temperature to 350° and bake for an additional 45 minutes, or until the crust is brown.
You can test to see if the apples are done by sticking fork prongs through a hole in the top of the pie.

name: Chocolate Cream Pie
ingredients: sugar (1 2/3 cup for 9-inch, 1 1/4 cup for 8-inch, 5/8 cup for 6-inch)
salt (2/3 tsp for 9-inch, 1/2 tsp for 8-inch, 1/3 tsp for 6-inch)
cornstarch (2 2/3 tbsp for 9-inch, 2 tbsp for 8-inch, 1 1/3 tbsp for 6-inch)
cocoa (6 tbsp for 9-inch, 4 tbsp for 8-inch, 2 tbsp for 6-inch)
flour (1 1/3 tbsp for 9-inch, 1 tbsp for 8-inch, 1/2 tbsp for 6-inch)
milk (2 2/3 cups for 9-inch, 2 cups for 8-inch, 1 1/3 cups for 6-inch)
egg substitute (3/4 cup for 9-inch, 1/2 cup for 8-inch, 1/4 cup for 6-inch)
margarine (2/3 tbsp for 9-inch, 1/2 tbsp for 8-inch, 1/3 tbsp for 6-inch)
vanilla (1 1/3 tsp for 9-inch, 1 tsp for 8-inch, 1/2 tsp for 6-inch)
instructions: Mix sugar, salt, cornstarch, cocoa and flour in top of double boiler. Stir in milk. Bring to boil over low heat, and boil 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.

Stir a little of the hot mixture into the egg substitute...then blend into hot mixture. Place over boiling water, and cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Blend in margarine. Cool thoroughly. Blend in vanilla.
Pour into cooled baked pie shell. Finish with meringue (see recipe, this section).

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
tableNote: *This makes a creamy filling. For stiffer filling, increase cornstarch (1 tablespoon more for 9" pie, 3/4 tablespoon for 8" pie, 1/3 tablespoon for 6" pie).
ingredients: sugar (1 1/2 cup for 9-inch, 1 1/8 cup for 8-inch, 1/2 cup for 6-inch)
cornstarch (6 tbsp for 9-inch, 4 1/2 tbsp for 8-inch, 2 tbsp for 6-inch)
boiling water (1 1/2 cups for 9-inch, 1 1/8 cups for 8-inch, 1/2 cup for 6-inch)
egg substitute (3/4 cup for 9-inch, 1/2 cup for 8-inch, 1/4 cup for 6-inch)
margarine (3 tbsp for 9-inch, 2 tbsp for 8-inch, 1 tbsp for 6-inch)
lemon juice (4 tbsp for 9-inch, 3 tbsp for 8-inch, 1 1/3 tbsp for 6-inch)
grated lemon rind (1 1/2 tbsp for 9-inch, 1/8 tbsp for 8-inch, 1/2 tbsp for 6-inch)
instructions: Mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in boiling water, cook over direct heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils. Set over boiling water and cook 10 minutes longer. Beat a little of the hot mixture into the egg substitute.

Then beat into hot mixture in double-boiler. Cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from over hot water. Blend in margarine, lemon juice, rind. Cool. Pour into cooled baked pie shell. Cover with meringue. Bake. Serve cool.
For LIME MERINGUE PIE: Use lime in place of lemon and leave out margarine in recipe for Lemon Meringue pie. Add a few drops of green coloring to intensify the color.

name: Pie Crust
servings: Makes one 2-crust 8" pie or two 1-crust 8" pies
ingredients: 4 to 6 tablespoons of cold milk (2%, 1/2% or skim)
instructions: It is not easy to make this type of pastry. Nevertheless, it can be done, and it is delicious, tender and flaky. Along the way, though, it will crumble and crack, need patching here and there, and never get quite as thin as you think that it should. Don't give up! After a few exasperating experiences, you'll be able to whip up this tender pastry in very little time. The baking soda is the magic touch that makes the pastry especially tender.

Method: Sift dry ingredients together into a bowl. In another bowl, beat oil and milk with a rotary beater or hand mixer until it has a milky appearance. Make a "well" in the dry ingredients. Pour the liquids into the "well" all at once.

Take a fork and slowly work the ingredients together. DO NOT ADD MORE FLOUR! By hand, work the mixture into a ball. Place on wax paper. Cover with plastic wrap and roll out to desired size. Invert, and remove wax paper.
Slip crust into pie pan that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray and remove plastic wrap.
Bake for ten minutes at 400° F.

name: Blueberry Pie Filling
ingredients: 4 cups of fresh or frozen blueberries
3 tablespoons of cornstarch with fresh blueberries, OR 5 tablespoons of cornstarch with frozen blueberries
instructions: Boil one cup of blueberries with water and sugar; strain. Add cornstarch to liquid; boil until thick. Remove from heat and add lemon juice. Stir in remaining blueberries.
Before putting blueberries in baked crust, line the bottom of the crust with a thin layer of cream cheese. Cool.
Spread light Cool Whip on top before serving.

name: Cherry Pie Filling (Quick)
source: A Favorite Recipe of Alma Finken Carle
ingredients: 1 ounce of low fat cream cheese
1 can (16 oz) of water packed, pitted, red sour cherries
instructions: Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan. Add juice drained from cherries, almond extract, and orange rind. Blend and cook over low heat, stirring with a wire whisk, until thickened. Syrup should come to a boil.
Line the bottom of the baked pie shell with a thin layer of low fat cream cheese. Spread cherries over the pie shell, cover with the sauce, and chill. Spread light Cool Whip over pie before serving.

name: Karo Nut Pie
source: Favorite Nut Pie Recipe of Alma Finken Carle
ingredients: 1/2 cup of white (preferred) or dark Karo
1 cup of pecan pieces (each 1/2 pecan broken into four pieces)
instructions: Combine all of the ingredients EXCEPT THE NUTS and beat well with an electric mixer.
Add the nuts, blend, and pour mixture into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 325° F for 40 minutes, or longer if necessary.
Wilfred Carle's favorite pie to eat!

name: Peanut Butter Pie
ingredients: 2 cups of scalded milk (2%, 1/2% or skim)
2 tablespoons of margarine (beat with egg yolks)
instructions: Combine peanut butter and powdered sugar. Mix until crumbly. Spread 3/4 of this in baked pie shell.
Combine sugar, cornstarch and salt. Add scalded milk and mix well.
Pour this into the beaten egg yolks, or egg substitute, a small amount at a time. Pour this into milk mixture and cook in top of a double boiler until thickened. Add vanilla and margarine.

Pour into baked pie shell and top with meringue made from three beaten egg whites. Brown; when almost brown enough, sprinkle remainder of peanut butter and powdered sugar mix on top. Continue baking until brown.

name: Pumpkin Pie
ingredients: 1 can (16 oz) of solid pack pumpkin
1 1/2 cups (12 oz can) undiluted Carnation evaporated skim milk
instructions: Preheat oven to 425° F. Combine filling ingredients in order given and mix well.

Pour into 9" unbaked homemade pie shell with high fluted edge. Bake for fifteen minutes. Reduce the temperature to 350° F. Bake an additional forty-five minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool. Spread light Cool Whip on top before serving.

name: Strawberry Glaze Pie (French)
ingredients: 1 quart of fresh strawberries (washed, drained, & hulled)
3 ounce package of cream cheese (no-fat or low fat)
instructions: Line the bottom of a cooled baked 9" pie shell with the cream cheese. Cover this with the choicest half of the strawberries.
Mash and strain the remaining strawberries until juice is extracted. If necessary, add a little water to make 1 & 1/2 cups of juice.
Put juice in pot over heat and bring to the boiling point. Gradually stir in mixture of the sugar and cornstarch.
Cook over moderate heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and let it boil for one minute. Cool, and pour over berries in the pie shell. Chill in refrigerator for about two hours.
Remove from refrigerator about 20 minutes before serving to take chill from the crust.
Spread light Cool Whip on top before serving.

name: Bean Salad
source: Mrs. Harriet Pooley, Heber Springs, Arkansas
ingredients: 1 can of kidney or Lima beans
1 large green pepper cut into small pieces
1 large red pepper or pimento cut into small pieces
instructions: Drain vegetables, then marinate in a mixture of: 3/4 cup of vinegar, 1 cup of sugar, 1/4 cup of water, 1 & 1/2 tablespoons of salad oil

Note: Ingredients can be varied in type or quantity to suit taste, such as adding pickles and pickle juice, or reducing sugar to 1/2 cup and substituting some artificial sweetener. Small quantities of dill or parsley can be used.
Note: Vegetable relish salad recipe in this section calls for bringing the marinade to a boil before adding to the vegetables and then refrigerating the salad overnight before serving.

name: Blueberry Jello Salad
ingredients: 1 family size (6 oz) red raspberry jello
1 regular size (3 oz) red raspberry jello
1/2 cup of cold water (add to gelatin)
1 carton or package (8 oz) of cream cheese
1/2 cup or more of chopped pecans
1 can (15 oz) of blueberries, include the juice
instructions: FIRST LAYER: Mix 6 ounces of jello with 3 & 1/2 cups of hot water. Put in loaf pan. Chill until very firm.
SECOND LAYER: Heat milk while adding sugar and gelatin (do not boil) until they dissolve. Add vanilla and softened cream cheese. Mix and add nuts. Cool slightly and pour over first layer. Chill.
THIRD LAYER: Add one cup of hot water to regular size (3 oz) of jello, stir well. Add blueberries and juice. Cool slightly and pour over first mixture. Chill until very firm.
Note: See Raspberry Jello Salad for a simpler recipe

name: Cranberry Orange Relish
ingredients: 1 package (12 to 16 oz.) fresh or frozen cranberries
instructions: Slice un-peeled oranges into eighths, remove seeds. Grind the cranberries and orange slices in a meat grinder. Stir in sugar to desired sweetness. Store in refrigerator for two or three days before eating for best results.

name: Oriental Salad
ingredients: 3 bags of cole slaw (10 ounces each, from super-market)
2 packages (3 ounces each) of "Oriental" Ramen noodle soup mix
1 cup of safflower or canola oil
instructions: Toast almonds and sesame seeds in toaster oven, or saute in sesame oil. Add these to cole slaw and chopped onions. Add Ramen noodles (save seasoning packets for use in dressing). Mix well.

DRESSING: COMBINE FOLLOWING, SHAKE WELL, POUR OVER ABOVE SALAD AND MIX WELL - 1 cup of safflower or canola oil, 6 tablespoons of rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper, 1/4 cup of sugar, seasoning packets (from Ramen noodles).

name: Raspberry Jello Salad
ingredients: 1 family size (6 oz) red raspberry jello
1 can (15 oz) of blueberries, save the juice
1 can (medium) of pineapple tidbits, save the juice
1/2 cup of nuts (whole, or in small pieces)
instructions: Combine two cups of boiling water (mixed with the pineapple and blueberry juices) with the jello. Add raspberries and pineapple and chill in the refrigerator.
Combine the sour cream, cream cheese and sugar. Mix well. Spread over the top of the chilled jello mixture. Sprinkle the nuts over the top.
This is a recipe from Aunt Alice Carle and is simpler than the Blueberry Salad recipe.
Note: If fresh blueberries, freeze first and then cook a little before using.

name: Vegetable Relish Salad
ingredients: 1 can of "shoe peg" white sweet corn
1 can of french style green beans
1 can of LeSeur early green garden peas
1 cup of chopped green bell peppers
instructions: Drain all vegetables in colander with exception of two tablespoons of green bean juice (take from can prior to draining). Save vegetable juices for soup.
Sauce: Mix all sauce ingredients well. Bring to a boil, pour over vegetables, stir, then refrigerate overnight before serving.

name: Bechamel Sauce Topping
ingredients: 1/3 cup of Cream of Rice cereal
instructions: In a saucepan, bring milk, seasoned with salt, to a boil. Add Cream of Rice and cook, while stirring, for one minute. Remove from heat, cover, and allow to stand for 5 minutes. Pour into a blender and blend until smooth.

name: Cocktail Sauce
ingredients: 1 to 2 tablespoons of prepared horseradish, or to taste
1 & 1/2 tablespoons of lemon juice, if desired
instructions: Mix well

name: The Little English Muffin Pizza
source: Favorite Appetizer of Drew Carle - Created for Drew by his Grandmother Alma Finken Carle
instructions: Spread each muffin half with pizza sauce. Quantity of sauce used is a matter of personal preference. Add Mozzarella cheese in desired quantity and sprinkle with bacon bits.
Bake in toaster oven at 400° for ten minutes, or until cheese is bubbly. Serve hot.

name: Royal Rice
ingredients: 1/2 cup of finely chopped green onions (including tops)
3 cups CHEFWAY CONDITIONED rice cooked in chicken or beef broth
1 can (4 ounces) of sliced mushrooms, drained
instructions: Saute onions in margarine until tender. Add rice, mushrooms and salt. Heat thoroughly. Fluff lightly with a fork. Makes six servings.

name: Carrot Soup
ingredients: salt and white pepper to taste
instructions: In heavy saucepan, melt margarine over moderate heat. Stir in celery and onions and cook five minutes until soft but not brown. Add carrots, chicken broth, tomato paste and rice. Simmer for thirty minutes. Puree the soup through a food mill or a blender until smooth. Season and stir into milk. Reheat before serving. Add margarine and garnish with carrot curls. Serves 6.

name: Chili
ingredients: 2 packages of Williams Cajun Chili Seasoning
2 cans (15 oz.) of Joan of Arc Chili Beans
2 cans (9 oz. each) of chopped tomatoes
2 cans (8 oz. each) of tomato sauce
instructions: Grind chicken, chuck, and onions together. Add olive oil and saute in covered heavy pot until meat is done.

Add seasoning, tomato sauce, chopped tomatoes, and garlic buttons. Simmer in covered pot for 1 & 1/2 hours, stirring from time to time. Add chili beans and simmer for another 1/2 hour, or longer if desired. Stir from time to time.

name: Hearty Chowder
ingredients: 1 cup or less of turkey ham - cubed
4 cups of milk (2%, 1/2%, or skim milk)
1/8 teaspoon of garlic powder, or 1 clove of garlic, mashed
dash of freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Pre-cook the potatoes and carrots (separately-carrots take longer to cook) until almost done in boiling salted water. Drain.

Meanwhile, melt margarine in heavy kettle or dutch oven. Add turkey ham and garlic and cook over low heat for about five minutes. Add celery broccoli and onions and continue to cook over low heat until vegetables are soft but not brown.
Blend flour, ham, garlic, celery broccoli and onions. Add milk slowly; continue to cook and stir until mixture is smooth and thickened.
Add potatoes and carrots. Adjust seasoning. Cover and cook over very low heat (DO NOT LET COME TO A BOIL) until chowder is piping hot and carrots are tender.

name: Sugar Cookies (Preferred Recipe)
source: Recipe used by Alma Carle when children were small (1950's)
instructions: Sift flour, salt, and baking powder together. Cream margarine and sugar together, add egg and vanilla; then add sifted ingredients and milk. Roll out to desired thickness. Cut into various shapes. Sprinkle with sugar and bake on baking sheet in moderate oven (375) for 12 minutes. Makes 2 1/2 dozen average size cookies.
DOUBLE BATCH: one TUB SMART BEAT (11 TBSP), 5 TBSP EGG WHITE, 1 CUP EGG BEATERS (4 EGGS), 1 1/2 TBSP VANILLA, 1 Tsp salt, 2 Tbsp milk - skim, 4 cups flour

name: Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: 1 recipe Basic Sweet Dough (see recipe, this section)
instructions: Prepare Basic Sweet Dough and let rise until doubled.
Roll dough into rectangle about 1/4 inch thick.
Brush with melted margarine.
Mix sugar and cinnamon together and sprinkle over dough.
Roll up jelly-roll fashion and cut into 1-inch slices.
Place in greased pan and let rise until doubled.
Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes until golden brown.
Frost with confectioners' sugar icing if desired.

name: Swedish Tea Ring
ingredients: 1 recipe Basic Sweet Dough (see recipe, this section)
instructions: Prepare Basic Sweet Dough and let rise until doubled.
Roll into rectangle and brush with melted margarine.
Sprinkle with sugar, cinnamon, and nuts or raisins.
Roll up jelly-roll fashion and form into ring on greased baking sheet.
Cut slits 2/3 through ring at 1-inch intervals and twist each section slightly.
Let rise until doubled.
Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes.
Frost with confectioners' sugar frosting while warm.

name: Kolaches
ingredients: 1 recipe Basic Sweet Dough (see recipe, this section)
Fruit preserves or poppy seed filling
instructions: Prepare Basic Sweet Dough and let rise until doubled.
Pinch off pieces of dough and form into balls about 2 inches in diameter.
Place on greased baking sheet and let rise until doubled.
Make indentation in center of each roll and fill with preserves or filling.
Bake at 375°F for 15-20 minutes until golden brown.
Dust with confectioners' sugar when cool.

name: Refrigerator Rolls
ingredients: 1 recipe Basic Sweet Dough (see recipe, this section)
instructions: Prepare Basic Sweet Dough.
After first rising, punch down and place in greased bowl.
Cover tightly and refrigerate up to 4 days.
When ready to use, remove desired amount and shape into rolls.
Let rise until doubled, about 1-2 hours.
Bake at 375°F for 15-20 minutes until golden brown.

name: Quick Coffee Cake
ingredients: Topping: 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 teaspoons cinnamon, 2 tablespoons melted margarine
instructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in bowl.
Add oil, milk, and egg. Beat until smooth.
Pour into greased 9x9 inch pan.
Mix topping ingredients and sprinkle over batter.
Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes.

name: Banana Bread
instructions: Mix oil and sugar. Add eggs and beat well.
Stir in mashed bananas.
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to banana mixture.
Fold in nuts if using.
Pour into greased 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.

name: Zucchini Bread
instructions: Beat eggs until foamy. Add sugar, oil, zucchini, and vanilla.
Sift together dry ingredients and add to egg mixture.
Fold in nuts if using.
Pour into 2 greased 9x5 inch loaf pans.
Bake at 325°F for 60-70 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.

name: Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, and spices.
Beat eggs, add pumpkin, water, and oil.
Add dry ingredients to pumpkin mixture and mix well.
Pour into 2 greased 9x5 inch loaf pans.
Bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.

name: Brownies
instructions: Melt margarine and stir in sugar. Add eggs and vanilla.
Combine cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Stir into sugar mixture.
Fold in nuts if using.
Spread in greased 9x9 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes. Do not overbake.
Cool and cut into squares.

name: Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: Cream margarine and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla.
Sift together flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Add to creamed mixture.
Stir in oats and raisins.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased baking sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Cream margarine and sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually blend into creamed mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips and nuts.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 9-11 minutes until golden brown.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
instructions: Cream margarine, peanut butter, and sugars. Add egg and beat well.
Sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Add to creamed mixture.
Roll into 1-inch balls and place on ungreased baking sheet.
Flatten with fork in crisscross pattern.
Bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.

name: Snickerdoodles
ingredients: Coating: 2 tablespoons sugar mixed with 2 teaspoons cinnamon
instructions: Cream margarine and sugar. Add eggs and beat well.
Sift together flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls.
Roll balls in cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Place on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 400°F for 8-10 minutes.

name: Gingerbread Cookies
instructions: Cream margarine and sugar. Add molasses and egg.
Sift together dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture.
Chill dough 2-3 hours.
Roll out on floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut with cookie cutters.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
Decorate with icing if desired.

name: Molasses Cookies
instructions: Mix oil, sugar, molasses, and egg.
Sift together dry ingredients and add to oil mixture.
Form into 1-inch balls and roll in sugar.
Place on greased baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.

name: Dinner Rolls
source: A Favorite Recipe of Alma Finken Carle
ingredients: 3 to 3 & 1/2 cups sifted bread flour (can use all purpose flour)
instructions: Sift together about 1/3 of the flour and all of the yeast.
Heat milk, oil, sugar and salt over low heat until hot to the finger, but no more. Stir to dissolve sugar and salt.
Add liquids to the flour-yeast mixture and beat with an electric mixer at medium speed for two minutes, or 300 strokes by hand.
Add another one-half to one cup of flour and beat for another minute with the electric mixer.
Stir in enough more flour to make a soft dough.
Turn onto a floured board and knead until smooth and elastic (eight to ten minutes).
Place in a bowl that has been coated with a nonstick vegetable spray. Spray the top of the mixture with the nonstick vegetable spray. Cover with wax paper and over that place a dry cloth.
Put in a warm place (80° to 85° F), free from drafts, and let rise until doubled (about one hour).
Punch dough down. Turn out onto a floured board again and shape into any desired form.
Place rolls on baking sheets that have been lightly coated with a nonstick vegetable spray, or in muffin cups and let rise again until doubled (takes one to one & one-half hours).
Pre-heat oven to 425° F. Bake for about ten minutes and serve 'piping hot'.

SHAPING OPTIONS: Cloverleaf - Form dough into little balls about 1/2" in diameter, coat with spray and place three balls in each muffin cup. Crescents - Roll to 1/4" thickness, cut wedges from 6" circle, brush with butter/oil, roll from wide end and curve. Parkerhouse - Roll to 1/4" thick, cut 3" circles, make depression below center, brush with butter, fold envelope style. Fantans - Roll to 1/8" thick rectangle, cut 1" strips, brush with butter, stack 6-7 strips, cut 1 1/4" pieces, place in muffin cups cut side up.

name: Sweet Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: 4 & 1/2 to 5 cups sifted all purpose flour
Melted margarine, cinnamon, sugar, and powdered sugar (for filling and glaze)
instructions: Sift two cups of the flour and the yeast together into a large bowl. Mix well.
Heat milk, water, sugar, oil and salt over low heat until warm, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Add liquids to flour-yeast mixture and beat until smooth (two to three minutes with an electric mixer, 300 strokes by hand).
Mix in egg whites. Add one more cup of flour and beat for another minute.
Add more flour and continue to beat until the dough is too stiff to continue.
Turn out onto a floured board and knead for eight to ten minutes, adding remaining flour as needed. Do not stint on the kneading time as it is necessary to develop the gluten.
Form the dough into a ball and place it into a bowl coated with a nonstick vegetable spray.
Cover, and let rise in the oven at 80° to 85° F, until doubled in bulk (takes one and one-half to two hours).
Punch down the dough and let it rest for ten minutes.
Then roll dough out to a thickness of from 1/2 to 3/4 inch.
Brush or spread with melted margarine and sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar.
Roll up (like a jelly roll) and cut crosswise at a thickness of 1 inch or as desired.
Leaving space between the rolls for them to rise, place them into pans coated with a nonstick vegetable spray, and spray tops.
Let rise again until doubled in size (this will take from thirty to forty-five minutes).
Bake in a pre-heated 375° F oven for twenty to twenty-five minutes, depending on size.
Glaze with powdered sugar.

name: Hush Puppies
instructions: Heat water until it boils. Add any garlic or onion at this time.
Add cornmeal slowly into the boiling water as you stir the mixture.
Keep stirring and cooking until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and add the egg (not necessary to beat the egg) or egg substitute. Stir until well mixed.
Let stand until cool enough to handle.
Take a spoonful at a time between your hands (moisten hands slightly with water and hush puppies will not stick to them) and shape into a finger size roll.
Place on a cookie sheet and cover with wax paper.
Let set at least one hour until you fry them in the fat that the fish was fried in.
Fry until golden brown and crispy on the outside.
